intro: Miricacalia pseudotaimingasa, commonly known as the Philippine violet. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant is native to the Philippines and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. It typically grows as an epiphyte or in shaded understory conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
